abstract: The Delaware Chancery Court made no immediate ruling Monday on a shareholder lawsuit seeking to delay the sale of Bear Stearns to JPMorgan Chase. The judge said he plans to issue a written ruling on the matter in the next several days.
lead_paragraph: The Delaware Chancery Court made no immediate ruling Monday on a shareholder lawsuit seeking to delay the sale of Bear Stearns to JPMorgan Chase. The judge said he plans to issue a written ruling on the matter in the next several days.

headline.main: Delaware Court Considers Suit Over Bear Sale

abstract: JPMorgan Chase & Company, the banking giant, said on Monday it had awarded its chief executive Jamie Dimon, who struck a deal last month to buy troubled Bear Stearns, $28.86 million in compensation in 2007, a 5 percent increase over the previous year.
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase & Company, the banking giant, said on Monday it had awarded its chief executive Jamie Dimon, who struck a deal last month to buy troubled Bear Stearns, $28.86 million in compensation in 2007, a 5 percent increase over the previous year.
